name: In The Shadow Of My Opponent's Fingers: I Love To Fight
name_original: In The Shadow Of My Opponent's Fingers: I Love To Fight
description:
Years ago in a nondescript land, a man with a large palm wrote musings of the art of “BUARTE”. Modern techniques such as Jiu Jitsu and Taekwondo prevailed through time and culture with martial arts centres teaching these techniques to this day. However, the art of “BUARTE” has always been known to be the most powerful of them all. Perhaps it was a good sign this technique of old was left to time?

You are a young child called SMACKO. After a Man-Sized Ant bit your hand one fateful evening, it has swelled to unethical proportions. Was it fate that your hand became large in tandem with your name? You have seen every doctor available to reduce the size of your disgusting large mitt, but most of them end up as a red smear on the ceiling. You must hone your skills and train this new finger-might.

Will you die a man or a hand? Find out in the compelling, yet tragic, yet coming of age, yet introspective and autobiographical tale of IN THE SHADOW OF MY OPPONENT’S FINGERS: I LOVE TO FIGHT.
